v.v: A shoot will sprout from the stump of Jesse, and a branch out of his roots will bear fruit.
The Spirit of Yahweh will rest upon him, the Spirit of wisdom and understanding,
His delight will be the fear of the Lord;
Instead, he will judge the poor with righteousness and decide fairly for the humble of the earth.
Righteousness will be the belt of his waist, and faithfulness the belt around his hips.
The wolf will live with the lamb, and the leopard will lie down with the young goat,
The cow and the bear will graze together, and their young will lie down together.
A baby will play over the hole of the snake,
They will not hurt nor destroy on all my holy mountain;

v: the Spirit of instruction and might, the Spirit of knowledge and of the fear of Yahweh.
he will not judge by what his eyes see, nor decide by what his ears hear.
He will strike the earth with the rod of his mouth, and with the breath of his lips he will slay the wicked.
the calf, the young lion and the fattened calf, together. A little child will lead them.
The lion will eat straw like the ox.
and the weaned child will put his hand on the serpentâ€™s den.
for the earth will be full of knowledge of Yahweh, as the waters cover the sea.

v.v: On that day, the root of Jesse will stand as a banner for the peoples.
On that day, the Lord will again extend his hand
He will set up a banner for the nations and will gather the outcasts of Israel
He will turn aside the envy of Ephraim, and hostilities of Judah will be cut off.
Instead they will swoop down on the Philistine hills on the west,
Yahweh will completely destroy the gulf of the Sea of Egypt.
There will be a highway for the remnant of his people that return from Assyria,

v: The nations will seek him out, and his resting place will be glorious.
to recover the remnant of his people who remain in Assyria, Egypt,
Pathros, Cush, Elam, Shinar, Hamath, and the islands of the sea.
and the dispersed of Judah from the four corners of the earth.
Ephraim will not envy Judah, and Judah will no longer be hostile to Ephraim.
and together they will plunder the people of the east.
They will attack Edom and Moab, and the people of Ammon will obey them.
With his scorching wind he will wave his hand over the Euphrates River
and will divide it into seven streams, so it can be crossed over in sandals.
as there was for Israel in their coming up from the land of Egypt.
